properties.name: Peninsula Park
properties.description: Posted by Jmarleneh  700 N. Rosa Parks Way, PortlandCome smell the roses at Peninsula Park and dip your feet in its timeless fount. It will take you back to its opening in 1912. Peninsula Park boasts Portland\'s first community center and was the original home of Portland\'s Official Rose and its annual Rose Show before moving to Washington Park.

properties.name: Po' Shines Cafe De La Soul
properties.description: Posted by Jmarleneh 8139 N Denver Portland, ORPo\' Shines was the first restaurant in the area to catch my eye from the bus 4 route. As I learned more about how operates as a non-profit it also captured my heart. All of the staff volunteer their time and the proceeds go to helping young people in the community. "Our mission is simple: feed the community and feed it well. Mind, Body & Soul." -Po\' Shines Website

properties.name: The City in A City
properties.description: Posted by Jmarleneh Maywood, OrThe City of Maywood Park sits by the edge of the I-205 highway. Its sign "Welcome to the City of Maywood Park" always confused me. I always imagined the residents to be a typical older person indignant with the way the area has changed. Their city website boasts their Christmas Light and annual Easter celebration. I once heard that my freshman English teacher lived here and perhaps I\'ll forever think of its residents as caricatures of him. He was an evil Dr. Phil near retirement who despised freshmen and who was rumored to have thrown a stapler at a student once.
